etymology.description: Depicts one-half of 門(門) (mén, "gate") -> stylized as 𠁣(𠁣) -> final form 戶(戶) (hù, "door")
etymology.interpretation: The character 戶(戶) (hù, "door") represents a single door panel, derived from the depiction of half a gate, symbolizing entry or a threshold.
etymology.simplification: 户 is a simplified and variant traditional form of 戶, streamlining the pictorial elements to a more abstract representation, but retaining the symbolic essence of a door or entrance.

examples.chinese: 他推开了戶(他推開了戶)。
夜晚降临时(夜晚降臨時)，古宅的戶缓缓开启(古宅的戶緩緩開啟)。
examples.pinyin: Yè wǎn jiàng lín shí, gǔ zhái de hù huǎn huǎn kāi qǐ.
examples.english: When night falls, the door of the ancient house slowly opens.
